abstract.p: European postal regulators order Deutsche Poste, Europe's largest mail company, to immediately open part of its delivery network to United Parcel Inc; order means Deutsche Poste must now forward many United Parcel packages to their final address at discount; ruling is setback for Deutsche Poste, which has purchased controlling stake in DHL International (S)

block.p: In a break for United Parcel Service Inc., postal regulators ordered Deutsche Poste, Europe's largest mail company, to immediately open part of its delivery network to United Parcel. The order means Deutsche Poste must now forward many United Parcel packages to their final address at a discount. The ruling is a setback for Deutsche Poste, which just a few days earlier strengthened its dominance in European delivery operations by purchasing a controlling stake in DHL International, a Brussels-based package delivery service.

In a break for United Parcel Service Inc., postal regulators ordered Deutsche Poste, Europe's largest mail company, to immediately open part of its delivery network to United Parcel. The order means Deutsche Poste must now forward many United Parcel packages to their final address at a discount. The ruling is a setback for Deutsche Poste, which just a few days earlier strengthened its dominance in European delivery operations by purchasing a controlling stake in DHL International, a Brussels-based package delivery service.
